content: 51-49, with a +/- 4.5% margin of error, is not much hang a policy-making "hat" on. Second, the answer to the question "then what?" has not be articulated. Once a war is started with Iran, how will it be conducted and what is the exit strategy? Is Israel prepared for the fall out in & around it's own country? Also, is the US prepared for the implications of an attack on Iran?

content: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: 51-49, with a +/- 4.5% margin of error, is not much hang a policy-making "hat" on. Second, the answer to the question "then what?" has not be articulated. Once a war is started with Iran, how will it be conducted and what is the exit strategy? Is Israel prepared for the fall out in & around it's own country? Also, is the US prepared for the implications of an attack on Iran? How many fronts are we capabile of now that it is said N.Korea detonated another Nuke? How will we fund it? where will the troops come from without a draft, and where will we train them now that many facilities have been closed. Iran, Iraq, Afganistan, Pakistan, N.Korea, Where will this money come from?? How large will the defense budget have to be? At what point do we bring all the troops home, Admit were writing checks our azz cant cash and turn everything over to the UN where it should have been all along.

content: Is Israel willing to give up its own stockpile of nuclear weapons and long range missiles? If not what right do they have to be upset if Tehran has them? I don't want to see a nuclear armed Iran, but what is Iran going to do with a handful of warheads versus the 100 or so Israel has.
reply: Is Israel willing to give up its own stockpile of nuclear weapons and long range missiles? If not what right do they have to be upset if Tehran has them? I don't want to see a nuclear armed Iran, but what is Iran going to do with a handful of warheads versus the 100 or so Israel has.

content: We believe what we do. NO I do not believe that all Muslims feel this way no more than I believe all Christians believe they are the only true religion. But there are plenty of far right wingers that do believe Christianity is the only true religion and it is quite logical for those to think that all Muslims believe the same for their faith. Thus the reason for many of wars in the past. Which is why we live in a nation where everyone has the right to worship whatever or whoever they want without retaliation or retribution.

The technology is there and they want the nukes. My opinion is the time is very close, they may or may not be waiting for the elections, but that is something they will decide upon for themselves and themselves alone, not from what any other country including the U.S. tells them. How could they possibly trust a U.S. call knowing how bad we screwed the pooch with Iraq? I sure in hell wouldn't no matter who was President because our government is too big and too out of touch with each other. The right arm still does not know what the left arm is doing and we are just as vulnerable today for another 911 as we were on 911.
